transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi, this is Arjun calling from MongoDB. Is this still a good time?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, hey Arjun. I have a few minutes—what’s up?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, I’ll keep it brief. I saw Acme Corp. is running MongoDB on-prem and, with your recent cost optimization push, thought it might help to chat about Atlas, our managed cloud offering.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we’re, uh, always looking at cost. Managed comes up, but moving feels risky.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Completely fair. Honestly, migration is the first thing most teams mention. But Atlas has automated tools and white-glove support for moving from on-prem, so you’re not alone at any step.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Mm, okay. Our CTO’s biggest concern is data security and compliance. We handle a lot of sensitive info.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely—and that’s central for Atlas, too. We’re certified for SOC 2, ISO, GDPR, all the big ones. Plus, you can get VPC peering, disk-level encryption, and very granular access controls.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Isn’t cloud… more expensive, though? I mean, we already own our hardware.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Good question. The sticker price can look higher at first, but when you factor in patching, scaling, disaster recovery, and, honestly, engineers’ time, most SaaS teams see savings over 18–24 months.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hmm. And we wouldn’t get stuck with one vendor, would we? Vendor lock-in worries me.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, totally get it. Atlas supports AWS, GCP, and Azure, so you can move your clusters between clouds or even back on-prem if you ever need to.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Alright. I’d need to see some numbers and maybe a migration plan example.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. Can I send over a short email with a TCO calculator, reference migrations, and compliance docs? Maybe you can share specific requirements too?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, send that over. I’ll forward it to our infra lead as well. Thanks, Arjun.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Of course! I’ll get that to you by end of day. Appreciate your time, Zhi.
